posts.content:
Yea mate -

Still 'bogs' a little bit but otherwise runs sweet

Fancy a bit of a cruise at the weekend ??
nice 1 have you booked in for the mot?, yeah will defo have a cruise if everything goes to plan
SWWWWWWING! Love it mate, looks awesome, well done

Nice bus dude, bet you're pleased as punch with it!

Are you leaving the red insert in the deluxe trim fella? As can't work out if it goes or would look better with black or green insert????? Sorry, not a criticism, just a work colleague & myself are looking at it together & we can't make pur minds up on it!
its sweet man i think the red works on the trim. When you gonna be able to get it out of the barn? i hear there's a broken digger in the way

Ricks Bugs & Buses wrote:
Nice bus dude, bet you're pleased as punch with it!

Are you leaving the red insert in the deluxe trim fella? As can't work out if it goes or would look better with black or green insert????? Sorry, not a criticism, just a work colleague & myself are looking at it together & we can't make pur minds up on it!
Have to agree, go for black.

Bogging down?? have you lubed the 009?
Thats a fantastic bus, I really like the look of it, top effort

Thanks for the kind comments guys !

Just passed its MOT this morning - so am now a well happy bunny !!

Congratulations!!

Another one on the road

thanks Ollie !!

Give me a shout if you get that zorst sorted....

ta

looking so much better now you have paid out for proper replacement steps and cali import doors ilke I asked for in the first place.

I see that .... long panel sill replacement i put in which was like a wave (according to you) has stayed put as well with your perfectionist new restorer.

Cool colour scheme, bus looks much nicer..... What suplier did you use for the new metal?


Look forward to seeing this around Durham

That's a very nice looking bus - as far as the trim insert goes, I'd stick with the red.

Unfortunately, my reason for coming into this thread aren't to do with the bus per se.

I've had a request to have a look at the thread with regard to comments made within the thread about work previously done on the bus. The SSVC have a *very* strict policy of not allowing threads that potentially defame or slander, whether the subject be a club member, forum member (or neither of those). The only exceptions have been when a court ruling has put the matter on a legal footing.

I've had a look through the thread, and I'm bound to say that there are numerous 'undesirable' comments that the subject has described in a PM to me in a completely different light. We're not interested in taking sides, or getting into 'he said/she said' discussions, as they inevitably turn into a slanging match. If you've got issues with a restorer, please take it up with them, not on here.

Slammeddeluxe - I'd like you to edit/remove any references as per above within 48 hrs of your next logon. If you don't know how to, PM me and I'll be happy to explain how, or do it for you. I'd also ask that comments made by others are also edited in a simliar timescale/fashion. I don't want this to sound too harsh, but the above is not open for discussion. It's one of the very few hard and fast rules, and we uphold it vigourously.
I've come straight into the thread with this rather than PM'ing Slammeddeluxe direct so as to be completely trasparent.

I've got to say, I'm glad this has been tackled by an approach to an admin, rather than (as has hapened on previous occasions) by the parties wailing on each other in one or more threads. I hope that you understand why I've felt necessary to post this.
